comments.commentBody: The word is treason. Trump and probably most of his campaign staff are guilty of it. Bigly. In addition to reading NYT, watch Maddow. She has done quite a good job covering this stuff.

replies.commentBody:
But: Comey's not clean. Look at how he appears to have colluded with all this.
Russians interfering with the election - hack DNC and Republican computer systems. They release embarrassing information designed to ensure a split between supporters of Bernie Sanders and the rest of the DNC who pretty much lined up after Hillary - and it worked. BUT they reveal nothing of what they collected about Trump, implying that they were supporting him. Then to top it off, Comey, breaking FBI rules (for which he has not been sanctioned at all) "reveals" a "new" batch of e-mails supposedly containing damming information from Hillary almost on top of the election. Naturally it inflames Hillary opponents. And these opponents pay no attention at all to the fact that Russians did NOT leak the information they said they had about Trump. Why didn't the Russian leak information about Trump?
? All orchestrated ? Maybe.
And last night in their town house meeting on CNN Senators Gallagher and McCain said "if the tampering had succeeded in interfering with the election" - Really?! They think Russian tampering didn't succeed?
And I do think they were giving their honest opinion. Looks to me like the Russian efforts succeeded all too well.

Why is easy. Trump ignores global warming because lowered environmental regulations make his pals richer and Putin wants global warming because it will open up a trillion dollars of Siberian fossil fuel development.

Bi-partisan legislation has already been filed in Congress to require that Congress approve any action by the Trump Administration to reduce the sanctions already imposed on Russia.

They will not easily alter them after this is passed, and it would be political suicide to attempt to do so before then.

comments.commentBody: First we wondered why, of all countries, Trump would be having a love affair with Putin and Russia while insulting our allies and trade partners.  Now you have to wonder why the talk of Russia has stopped, except to deny any contact during the campaign.  Could the White House, high IQ people that they are, be waiting for the Republicans in Congress to push it to the back burner and for the Press to tire of the story before they get around to reversing sanctions and giving Putin whatever he wants in the name of friendship? If Trump and his buddies looked at any publicly available info on Putin besides that on Fox, etc. they would know how much Putin hates the western world for the disrespect shown to his country. Also, how he aims to restore all ethnic Russian populations to a new Soviet Union, including Ukraine and the Baltic states. Hopefully, the intelligence community will gather and then share sufficient info for impeachment. This is no time for Comey to be bashful!

replies.commentBody: Running scared?  To be honest, I don't think Trump gives a damn.

comments.commentBody: The plot continues to thicken against Trump and his cronies.  Well there be more resignations in the White House?  Trump is running scared at this point.  He is being worn down and he will not be able to handle it all at the end of the day.  Like the wicked witch of the West, we are seeing a bucket of water being poured over Trump, and he is starting to melt before out very eyes.  The rats are going to start abandoning ship any day now.  Truth is going to win in the end.

replies.commentBody: When you said "they", I thought you meant the Russians!  Of course, nobody else could truly like the Grifter in Chief...

comments.commentBody: Ahhh! The sky is falling!! They're starting to like him! Quick, the Russians.

replies.commentBody: Like Trump said himself last night, why not make new friends out of old enemies?  What's Crimea, Ukraine, Hungry, The Baltics, Czech Republic  and Poland thrown into the bargain?

comments.commentBody: It's obvious that Trump is a Russian mole , planted in the Presidency by Putin....the two conspired to 'make America great again'.....OMG, their nefarious plot is starting to work!  Their next goal is to make Dems even more ineffective than they are today...the  secret plan was kicked off last night by hypnotizing Democratic Congresswomen and making them dress in polyester white pant suits.  Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of men? This is McCarthyism lite. When the economy hits a 3% growth rate this witch hunt will look ridiculous.

replies.commentBody: Very true, I'm afraid. And I AM afraid.

comments.commentBody: Trump seems to be compromised and under the influence of Putin's Russia, as much as the Republican Party is under the influence of the financial & Insurance sector of the U.S. The GOP will ignore any evidence against Trump just to continue their mission in life - to further the enrichment of the rich.  Patriotism is secondary to them in this endeavor.

Whatever happens to DT, I want to know how will the Republican leaders be held accountable - for their ambivalence, their silence, and outright complicity in killing resolutions that required disclosure of DT's taxes. Where are the patriots?

replies.commentBody: Hey Ajax if you are a American does it bother you that we pay 75% of NATO's budget to defend them not us?. Then ask how has NATO, a European group responsible for Europe's security, become fully involved in wars in Libya, Afghanistan and some African countries having zero to do with Europe?.

comments.commentBody: One way to break through this morass of deception and deflection is for the FBI to obtain all relevant information from NATO countries who undoubtedly had both Trump and Russia under surveillance during the campaign based on Trumps bizarre comments about degrading NATO during the election.

replies.commentBody: Nixon had his diehards too,....
How low the bar has been set.  Sad.

The Occupy Democrats organization has already filed a suit before the Supreme Court to nullify the election on the basis that the government failed to do its duty to defend the citizens' interests.

Trump won with the votes of independents and disaffected Clinton supporters, and protest votes. Those votes would very likely change sides in a new election.

In addition, he lost the popular majority, and won several states by razor-thin margins.

In a replacement election, a 2nd victory by Trump would nearly impossible, especially now that he can no longer count on 11th-hr interventions by the likes of Comey, and the success of fake news propagated by the Russians and commercial interests.

Once bitten, twice shy.

comments.commentBody: Even if is proved beyond the shadow of a doubt that he colluded with the Russians in business deals and that Russian hackers were able to skew the election, his fans undoubtedly will still support him. There is enough out there already that isn't a secret and which should be enough for impeachment proceedings, but one speech that wasn't insulting and full of lies and all seems to be forgiven.
I have tried to assure people that President Obama would not leave without making sure the Russian hacking information was secure. I'm so happy to see this article to confirm my thoughts ! We

replies.commentBody:
Having been threatened myself at one time, I believe it's possible President Obama was under a great deal of threat which is why he acted strangely. I think he was very muted, uncharacteristically so, about this topic.

Just look at the smile on his face now that he's outta there. It must be a great relief, while we all are stuck holding the bag of this administration. Please lord, help us.

Except it isn't that simple. It was still during the presidential campaign that the situation was unfolding. Had Obama said anything then, it would have been perceived as an attempt to sway the election.

What's simple is the fact that there's more to this story, and we still probably don't even know the half of it.
But blaming Obama? -- Seriously???
Do you have any idea how many channels are involved in clearing this kind of intelligence?

comments.commentBody: Obama waited too long and failed us on the important things. I'll never forgive him for failing to speak out and stop the Russian interference. It's that simple.

replies.commentBody: Your claim that both sides do it is ridiculous without any type of proof. I know that we live now in an era of alternative facts but that doesn't allow you to reconfigure reality in the past to your liking.

comments.commentBody:
In my honest opinion, both sides do it. Both parties have foreign countries outside of the United States intervening in U.S. presidential elections. That is the bottom line. You don't think that the European left didn't want Barack Obama in 2008 after the evil right-wing Bush/Cheney?

Both sides do it. I think that this will not affect anything. Donald J. Trump is the president. There is nothing that can be done but a potential impeachment of Trump and Pence if anything happens.

Both sides do it--Democrats and Republicans. Let's not play the moral high ground here.

I suspect one reason for Obama spreading the intelligence was because he knew, just as I did and probably many others, that Director "Comey" helped elect Trump as well as the Russians and that there will be no honest F.B.I. investigation both the Congress and the public can rely on.
They should have made it all public.

replies.commentBody: I,  like many others,  have wondered why someone who had displayed such hatred toward a particular person you allude to emerged from his first ever meeting with that person completely humbled, pale as a ghost, and offering new found praises saying he was " a good man".

comments.commentBody:
At this point, I think all of these anonymous sources in the intelligence community and the previous administration need to either produce something tangible, or conduct their investigations professionally and privately until they are ready to produce something tangible. I want to know if anything illegal or even unethical happened, but I'm not finding that out with all these stories. There are an awful lot of serious-sounding allegations and promises that this thing's going to blow wide open, but for all the damaging information these sources say they have, there is next to nothing in the way of proof backing it all up.

It begins to seem more agenda-driven than an unbiased, factual investigation, especially when anonymous former White House officials portray themselves as Noble Preservers of the Truth.

I truly hope all these people really are that concerned about the country, and are that sure that this administration did something dirty, and that's why they are unable to stay silent. Because if it's anything else, these people are going to have a lot of explaining to do.

Thank God America still has honest, hardworking, highly intelligent, motivated and sane people serving the American Dream. May the current Madman in Chief  pass swiftly from the national stage. He has poisoned so much already.

replies.commentBody:
We didn't hear from you when shoes were on the Resolute desk.

Just observing...

comments.commentBody: Barack is like a smart guy.  Trump and his entourage are truly ignorant---get your feet off my couch...

Why not start with Flynn?  Give him a Bengazi style interrogation about why he was meeting with Russian officials as a private citizen and discussing sanctions in direct violation to President Obama deciding which sanctions to impose.  Who authorized him to meet with Russian officials?  Why is he walking away scot-free?  It is time for republicans to put country ahead of their party or they will be obstructing justice.  Americans will not forget the republicans' traitorous actions.  They won't even demand the tax returns which hold the key to the puzzle.  Does Trump have HUGE russian loans?

replies.commentBody: The world likely has always been such a scary, deceptive place to some people, particularly those that align themselves with a particularly philosophy or way of looking at the world. People in power change and ways of dealing with the world often change with them. To my way of thinking Obama was one scary president. To others, it is Trump. Sort of a different version of the glass is half full or half empty, depending on the way we look at it.

comments.commentBody: My head is spinning. Isn't there someone, somehow, who can adjudicate these things? Demand to know what happen? The truth?  Isn't there an automatic provision for discovering THAT in the constitution? The world is such a scary, deceptive place right now.  What is the truth? So many angles. So hard to be optimistic about our existence as a race right now.

replies.commentBody: This is called the steady drip, drip, drip of information. It will all come out in due time. Where there's smoke...
By whom was it discredited and what is the evidence? What is your source?

comments.commentBody:
Yet another story about the Russian Connection full of bluff and innuendo but offering nothing of substance. What is there left to investigate? There is indeed no there there. If there was, it would have been leaked by now.

At least there was no reference to Christopher Steele's dossier, which has been soundly discredited.

We may have good reason to hope that the outgoing administration had the wisdom to use a scalpel instead of a hammer...pun semi-intended. Assuming the hubris of the bad actors, Obama's admin may have anticipated their attempts to avoid detection would be crude and reveal much more than they conceal.
Thanks, Obama.
as president and commander in chief, trump should want this all investigated and exposed. shouldn't he?

replies.commentBody: The intelligence Community wouldn't conduct the investigation the Senate would the Foreign Affairs committee.

It is not the intelligence officials who will give him a hearing. All they do is provide the information.

The Republicans are stalling because they are trying to figure out how to make this go away - you know, like the woman who is suing him, the Trump University students who sued him, the other 2 - 3,000 lawsuits against him, the emoluments clause, the hotel leases that are now no good because no government official is supposed to benefit, etc., etc., etc., etc. People are forgetting a lot of things. Trump is up to his eyeballs in trouble. When he became President he opened up a hole of vulnerability that wasn't there before, but he thinks he can talk his way out of anything. Just like many other big shots in history, his ego is going to bring him down.

comments.commentBody:
What was the point of this article? There is nothing new here. Members of Trump's transition team were in contact with foreign officials? Of course they were, that is routine. NYT has a half-dozen leakers and not one of them could prove anything illegal happened.

Should this be investigated? Absolutely- and an appropriate response should be taken against Russia- but let's stop pretending to be surprised that Russia would interfere with our election and remember that Trump getting elected was a shock to everyone. The real goal had always been to hurt the legitimacy of Hillary Clinton and hamper her presidency.

The republicans should push for an investigation to clear Trump and move on. I'm sure the main reason they are stalling is because they fear that the same intelligence officials who are leaking information to hurt Trump will not give him a fair and unbiased investigation.

As impossible as it is for most of us to believe that a president of this country could be allied with Russia, this latest information forces one to re-examine that belief.  Even if all of these contacts were never directly known to Pres. Trump as they took place, it is his duty to this country to insist on a full, open and independent investigation.  If he wants his presidency to survive and be successful, I feel he has no other choice.  It is time for country over ego for both Trump and the GOP Congressional leadership.
Not surprised in the  least and thank God these Obama employees were courageous enough to stand up for the truth!
